poem:
On Lifted Restrictions 

The white field
extends beyond borders,
long-range shadows
etching promises
on distant lands—
anticipation's quiver,
the measured breath
before release,
where every whispered hint
marks a trajectory
carved by hopes
and echoes
of faraway tremors.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Blinken hints US will lift restrictions on Ukraine using long-range arms in Russia The US secretary of state, Antony Blinken, gave his strongest hint yet that the White House is about to lift its restrictions on Ukraine using long-range weapons supplied by the west on key military targets inside Russia, with a decision understood to have already been made in private. Speaking in Kyiv alongside the UK foreign secretary, David Lammy, Blinken said the US". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
